result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrell W Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen (DNA) to State Crime Lab for testing. Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, victim and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due up to 25% of prison funds with the remaining balance due prior to the end of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
- Restitution set at ZERO.

As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearms, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment of $25,000.00 fine or both. Possess Weapon as a convicted felon 973.176(1). Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrell W Griffin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript ( 33 pages) commencing MAY 26, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Defendant Derrell W Griffin in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  

THE COURT SENTENCED THE Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 367 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

The Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
The Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Earned Release Program.

CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION ARE AS FOLLOW:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, victim, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due up to 25% of prison funds with the remaining balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1).
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Defendant Derrell W Griffin in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeds.  Statements made as to sentencing.

Attorney Steven Richard Kohn in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  Court has congested calendar and is unable to conduct sentencing hearing this morning.  Defense counsel is unavailable this afternoon.  Court orders sentencing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Steven Richard Kohn in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  State did not comply with victim notification.  Court is in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Court orders sentencing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Submissions by defense (to be considered at sentencing hearing), filed.

Defense counsel in Court.  Defense counsel unable to appear for 5/12/16 sentencing hearing due to a scheduling conflict.  State does not object to new date.  Matter is rescheduled to 5/10/16 at 8:30am in br. 35.  Defense counsel to notice State. MSCO notified.
Scanned:  State Subpoena.

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Defendant Derrell W Griffin in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State in not proceeding with amended information filed on 10/25/15, Court orders amended information withdrawn.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 of the original information.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Use of a Dangerous Weapon Enhancer DISMISSED.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court order defendant REMANDED.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

**4/18/16 jury trial date is vacated**

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Randall Schnieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on defense motion to withdraw speedy and adjourn jur trial.  Defendent withdraws speedy trial demand, defendant wished to proceed to trial with Attorney Kohn as counsel.  Court GRANTS motion.  Court vacates 2/17/16 jury trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Steven Kohn in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on defense motion to withdraw speedy trial demand and adjourn jury trial date.  Court is in trial and unable to produce defendant to conduct hearing today.  Court orders matter adjourned.  New trial date selected, subject to approval of the defendant.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  2/17/15 jury trial to remain on the Court's calendar.  Jury trial scheduled for 4/18/16 at 9:30am.

- to withdraw speedy trial demand and adjourn jury trial, filed. 
- to be heard 1/13/16 at 8:30am in Br. 35.
- filed.
with turn over to Justice Point for GPS monitoring.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn and Susan Roth in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for motion hearing today.  Defense bail motion argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Court reduces bail to $3500 with turn over to Justice Point for GPS supervision, all previously set terms and conditions of bail remain.  Defense enters SPEEDY trial demand (expires 3/1/16).  Counsel is not available for trial dates offered.  Court grants request for Attorney Roth to substitute in as counsel of record.  Counsel stipulates to evidence as to pending defense motion, motion hearing is no longer needed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is in trial and unable to conduct motion hearing today.  12/2/15 jury trial date is converted to motion hearing/bail bond hearing at 8:30am. Prosecutor is new to the case. Trial date to be selected on next date.
Count 2: Attempt First Degree Intentional  Homicide, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.01(1)(a), 393.50(3)(a), 939.32, a Class B Felony.
state's requested jury instructions/state's motion in limine/state's witness list/state's response to defendant's motion to admit prior violent acts of the accuser, filed.

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Derrell W Griffin in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is also scheduled for motion hearing and final pretrial today.  Court cannot proceed with motion today due to congestion. Court orders motion adjourned.  Defense files speedy trial demand today, Counsel advises the Court that defendant is WITHDRAWS SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.   Filed, amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty. Jury trial date of 12/2/15 scheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

- to admit prior bad acts of the accuser, filed by defense. 
- to be heard on 10/23/15 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10.23.15 and for jury trial on 12.2.15.

Attorney Steven R. Kohn in court, defendant Derrell W Griffin not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed with the court.

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Derrell W Griffin in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Quinton W.; Marquanna P.; Tatiana D. or Douglas G.

Defendant Derrell W Griffin in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Defendant Derrell W Griffin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
